column4: hey I want to replace my Hard disk but other than that all my configuration will be the same
is there any way to copy the OS to another disk ?
without reinstalling ?
something like a disk image ?
thers several ways to  copy the os.  You may have to reinstall grub and perhaps tweak the fstab file - depending on how you do it.
i used 'mondo/mindi' ages ago. havent tryed any other tools lately.
I will look for it
theres proberly a dozen+ other tools that ive never heard of that may do it better. depenng on your needs.
with mondo/mindi i could 'backup' to a network machine. then boot a mondo live cd. and restore from the network box. :)
that sounds nice
yes. Its an older tool Not sure how its changed in the last year or so,
whenyou start talking about backingup/restoring 300+GB of OS data these days.. it gets to be a task.
I have 5 Hdds plugged in this computer
heh. I had one pc with 8 at one time.. and was able to replace them all with a single hd. :)  Progress!
they total 750 GB ... I do not intend backing up all, I want to install to a sata instead of a Pata
another question somehow related. Does Ubuntu know RAID?
it can do raid.. but i dont use raid any more.
Why not ? Not stable?
i needed the hds elseware for one.. and really dident see that much of a gain for my needs.  I needed space. more then speed.
I see
http://www.mondorescue.org - is this it?
yep thats it.
